decks.notes: The key concept of this Sultai Control deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, card draw, and board wipes. The deck utilizes powerful control elements such as Heartless Act, Eliminate, Negate, and Disdainful Stroke to deal with threats from the opponent. It also includes card advantage and selection options like Cultivate, Omen of the Sea, and Mazemind Tome to ensure a steady stream of resources. The deck can win through the late game value engine of Yorion, Sky Nomad, while also having access to Emergent Ultimatum for powerful game-winning combos or threats.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Lovestruck Beast, while utilizing cards like Unleash Fury and Kazuul's Fury for burst damage. The deck also includes utility creatures like Shepherd of the Flock and Giant Killer to deal with opposing threats. Showdown of the Skalds provides card advantage and helps refill the board. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all the colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the board with small, aggressive white creatures known as Weenies and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent stream of attackers. The deck also includes cards that provide protection, such as Alseid of Life's Bounty and Selfless Savior, as well as cards that can pump up the creatures' power and toughness, like Halvar, God of Battle. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a Companion allows the player to constantly bring back small creatures from the graveyard to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with low-cost creatures and using equipment to enhance their abilities. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of attackers, while also providing protection with cards like Selfless Savior and Alseid of Life's Bounty. Halvar, God of Battle and Maul of the Skyclaves provide powerful boosts to the creatures, making them even more challenging to deal with. The deck also includes some control elements like Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats from the opponent. Overall, the strategy is to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent early on.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful beaters and pump spells like Embercleave. The deck also includes removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and The Akroan War to clear the way for your creatures to attack. The Great Henge provides additional card draw and life gain to keep up the pressure. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through fast and aggressive plays.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast, aggressive strategy. By utilizing powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Goldspan Dragon, and Bonecrusher Giant in combination with powerful removal spells and equipment like Embercleave, the deck aims to quickly deal damage and control the board. The mana base of the deck allows for consistent play of its spells and creatures, while the inclusion of cards like Lovestruck Beast and Brushfire Elemental provide additional versatility and ways to apply pressure to the opponent.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant early on to pressure the opponent. It includes cards like Shepherd of the Flock and Giant Killer to control the board and protect your key creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like Goldspan Dragon and Showdown of the Skalds to generate card advantage and close out the game quickly. With a mix of removal spells like Kazuul's Fury and combat tricks like Unleash Fury, this Naya Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats. By using cards like Eliminate and Heartless Act to deal with opposing creatures, along with disruption spells like Jwari Disruption, the deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes Emergent Ultimatum to search for game-winning combinations of spells and threats, while also generating value with Yorion, Sky Nomad's blink ability. With a mix of card advantage, resource denial, and powerful finishers, the Sultai Control deck seeks to outlast and overwhelm its opponents.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a large board presence and deal massive damage with Zenith Flare. Cards like Flourishing Fox, Drannith Stinger, and Valiant Rescuer are used to cycle while also putting pressure on the opponent. Rielle, the Everwise helps draw more cards while also growing in power. The deck also includes disruption spells like Memory Leak and Shredded Sails to control the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful cycling cards.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while efficiently drawing cards and controlling the field. It utilizes a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and mill cards to slow down the opponent's game plan. The creatures in the deck also provide additional benefits when cards are put into the opponent's graveyard, enhancing the control aspect of the deck. The mana base is designed to support the deck's flexibility and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively play powerful creatures such as Arni Brokenbrow, Questing Beast, and Kazandu Mammoth to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also features strong removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to control the board. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave provides additional power and resilience to the deck. By combining fast creature plays with impactful spells, the Gruul Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by quickly deploying aggressive creatures and burn spells. The goal is to deal damage as quickly as possible and overpower the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck takes advantage of efficient creatures like Robber of the Rich and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, along with powerful equipment like Embercleave to maximize damage output. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for additional utility with Frost Bite and Faceless Haven.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Torbran, Anax, and Embercleave, the deck aims to deal quick and efficient damage to the opponent while also maintaining board presence. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for the use of Frost Bite and Faceless Haven, providing additional removal and utility options. Overall, the deck relies on a fast-paced, proactive strategy to quickly defeat the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent through a mix of removal, counterspells, card draw, and powerful threats. By utilizing powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany, the deck aims to establish a dominant position on the battlefield. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support the three-color combination of blue, black, and green, ensuring consistent access to the deck's powerful spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while ramping into powerful late-game threats. It utilizes cards like Negate and Mystical Dispute to disrupt opponent's plans, alongside removal spells like Heartless Act and Shadows' Verdict to deal with threats. The deck also has plenty of card draw options like Behold the Multiverse and Alrund's Epiphany to maintain hand advantage. By combining efficient removal with strong late-game threats like Vorinclex and Emergent Ultimatum, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of creatures with powerful abilities, such as Edgewall Innkeeper, Brazen Borrower, and Goldspan Dragon, to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It takes advantage of cards like The Great Henge and Lovestruck Beast to generate value and maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's ability to deal damage efficiently. By carefully managing resources and leveraging the strengths of its creatures, the deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through strategic decision-making.
